column1: Accidents (unintentional injuries) are, by far, the leading cause of death among children and teens.

Evaluation may include: - Amniocentesis - Chorionic villus sampling - Fetal ultrasound - Genetic screening of the parents - Medical histories and childbirth history of the parents SIDS (SUDDEN INFANT DEATH SYNDROME) Putting infants on their back to sleep helps reduces the chance of SIDS.
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommend that infants be placed on their back for sleeping.
Open communication between the teen and parents or other persons of trust is very important for preventing teen suicide.
